predicate.note: Frames file for 'lead' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus
Do not tag adjectival usages, like "leading indicators"

example.name: cause to go
example.text: John led the unhappy group of travellers from the frying pan to the fire.

example.name: go before
example.text: California led the nation with $6.5 billion in net cash income last year.
example.arg: with $6.5 billion in net cash income

example.name: group
example.text: Dr. Talcott led a team of researchers from the National Cancer Institute and the medical schools of Harvard University and Boston University.
example.arg: a team of researchers from the National Cancer Institute and the medical schools of Harvard University and Boston University

role.descr: result, action or attribute on arg1

example.name: NP complement
example.text: It was just another one of the risk factors that *trace* led to the company's decision to withdraw from the bidding.
example.arg: *trace=that=just another one of the risk factors*
the company's decision to withdraw from the bidding
example.note: This is interesting, because the arg1 is technically 'the company'.

example.name: S complement
example.text: It does lead you to suspect imports are going down.
example.arg: to suspect imports are going down

example.name: passive
example.text: John was led *trace* to believe that the moon was made of green cheese.
example.arg: to believe that the moon was made of green cheese

roleset.name: begin

example.name: begin
example.text: John led off the party with a raunchy toast.

roleset.note: This probably won't occur, but for other possible structures refer to "begin"
